meanings.definition: To instill (an attitude, idea, or habit) by persistent instruction.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was inculcating the importance of kindness in her students.
meanings.sent2: Parents play a crucial role in inculcating good manners in their children.
meanings.sent3: The parrot inculcated the phrase 'Polly wants a cracker' after hearing it repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The coach was inculcating the winning mindset into the team before the championship.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder inculcated valuable life lessons through storytelling.

meanings.definition: To teach and impress by frequent repetitions or admonitions.
meanings.sent1: The mentor was inculcating the importance of perseverance in his protege.
meanings.sent2: The yoga instructor focused on inculcating proper breathing techniques in her students.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously inculcated the catchphrase into his routine for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The artist was inculcating a sense of creativity in the young minds through workshops.
meanings.sent5: The chef inculcated the secret recipe to his apprentice with precision.
